elements.title: vampire killing kit (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a vampire killing kit (example pictured) was donated to the Mercer Museum in the 1980s?

elements.title: François Glorieux (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that François Glorieux was a Belgian pianist and improvisor, conductor of the BBC Radio Orchestra and Stan Kenton's band, and arranger for Michael Jackson?

elements.title: Serious Sam: The Second Encounter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a developer on Serious Sam: The Second Encounter doubled its frame rate by removing one line of code?

elements.title: Penitential of Finnian (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Penitential of Finnian is the oldest known penitential?

elements.title: city council of Semarang, Indonesia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a former Dutch villa houses both the city council of Semarang, Indonesia, and the city's mayor?

elements.title: Salty Parker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Salty Parker, who spent 60 years in organized baseball, described his lifelong love of the game as "a beautiful disease"?

elements.title: Dutchess and Columbia Railroad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the directors of the Dutchess and Columbia Railroad stole back the railroad from a bankrupt lessee?

elements.title: Patrick Berry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that puzzle maker Patrick Berry has been called the "Thomas Pynchon of crosswords"?
